radiographic_examinations.findings: C3 vertebral body collapse and an underlying C3 lesion.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the thorax, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple skeletal lesions, a sternal mass, bilateral pulmonary nodules, bilateral adrenal masses, and an aortocaval lymph node conglomerate.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At two months after the initial diagnosis, showed progression of disease with enlargement of the right adrenal mass and the aortocaval conglomerate.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Right adrenal mass abutting the inferior vena cava and measured 5.1 x 3.5 x 6.1 cm, increase in aortocaval lymph node conglomerate to 3.4 x 4.7 x 6.2 cm.
2.4 x 1.7 cm left adrenal nodule and poorly defined right adrenal lesion with multiple sub-centimeter atypical cavitary lesions in bilateral lungs.
Reduction in size of the sternal metastatic lesion from 7.5 x 3.8 cm to 6.0 x 3.1 cm and of the right lateral fourth rib lesion from 5.2 x 3.8 cm to 2.4 x 1.3 cm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Showed an excellent response to chemotherapy.
